title: Francesco De Ferrari's biggest office peeve
text:
Most important question when hiring?

“Tell me about yourself and what drives you” can often provide an insight into people’s character and values very quickly. Ultimately, hiring people for their values is the most critical aspect in this increasingly dynamic and disrupted world.

What excites you right now?

De Ferrari likes to return with his family to Tuscany. Shutterstock

In terms of business, it's how technology is changing the game in so many places – solving problems, improving services, shaping client expectations and challenging businesses, governments and regulators to keep up.

At AMP we have a unique opportunity to reinvent our company and build a truly client-led financial services business that thinks and acts like a start-up.

What office habits annoy you?

When people fall into the trap of only seeing the negative – I’m a glass half-full person. It’s good to see the risks, but don’t be defeated by them.

Advertisement

What is your morning ritual/exercise regimen?

Having breakfast with my wife and kids is the best way to start the day. And I really enjoy the ferry ride to work, something quite unique to the magic of Sydney.

Favourite holiday spot?

I love adventure and exploring different places all the time and can’t wait to travel to all the wonderful locations in Australia. The only constant destination for our family has been a small seaside resort in Tuscany – even an itinerate family like ours needs to keep roots.

Last good book, podcast or film?

Built to Last, by Jim Collins

How do you unwind?

Spending time with my family. There’s nothing like helping my kids with homework to take my mind off work.

When do your best ideas come?

I am an extrovert and so enjoy problem solving in discussions with others. I generally find the best inspiration from entrepreneurs in very different businesses to ours or from my children. The next generation thinks and behaves very differently and we’ll need to adapt to the clients of tomorrow.

Read the full interview with Francesco De Ferrari in AFR BOSS magazine on Friday.
description: The AMP chief executive describes himself as a glass-half-full sort of person, so negativity at work is a no-no.
